intro: Anthospermum rigidum subsp. pumilum, commonly known as the small-leaved anthospermum, is a flowering plant native to parts of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its slender, erect stems and small, opposite leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. Its flowers are typically white or pale pink, clustered in small umbels, and bloom during the wet season. It is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories and rocky crevices.
